abstract.text: Initializes a Swift package with configuration options you provide.

inlineContent.text: The name of the Swift package, or
to use the package’s Git URL to deduce the name.
The list of supported platforms with a custom deployment target.
The name to use for C modules. If present, Swift Package Manager searches for a
file to get the additional flags required for a system target.
The package providers for a system target.
The list of products that this package makes available for clients to use.
The set of traits of this package.
The list of targets that are part of this package.
The list of Swift language modes with which this package is compatible.
The C language standard to use for all C targets in this package.
The C++ language standard to use for all C++ targets in this package.

abstract.text: Create reusable code, organize it in a lightweight way, and share it across your projects and with other developers.
The supported C language standard you use to compile C sources in the
package.
The supported C++ language standard you use to compile C++ sources in the
package.
A wrapper around an IETF language tag.
The configuration of a Swift package.
A package dependency of a Swift package.

The object that defines a package product.
A platform that the Swift package supports.
The Swift language mode used to compile Swift sources in the package
The system package providers that this package uses.
The basic building block of a Swift package.
A struct representing a package’s trait.
